revised_title: Double Metamorphosis in Decapodous Crustacea: A Study on Cancer Maenas
tldr: The author, J. V. Thompson, discovered that decapod crustaceans, such as the Cancer Maenas, undergo a double metamorphosis. First, they hatch as Zoea, then transform into Megalopa, and finally become the adult crab. This research provides a deeper understanding of the life cycle and development of crustaceans, which can help in the study of their biology and conservation.
